text.section:
Except as otherwise provided in this section, in exercising its corporate powers, the Corporation:
may carry out its corporate purposes without obtaining the consent of any other State unit; and
is not subject to:
the following provisions of the State Government Article:
the following provisions of the State Finance and Procurement Article:
The Corporation is subject to the Public Information Act.
The officers and employees of the Corporation are subject to the Maryland Public Ethics Law.

The officers and employees of the Corporation are not subject to:
Division II of the State Personnel and Pensions Article; or
the provisions of Division I of the State Personnel and Pensions Article that govern the State Personnel Management System.
The Corporation is subject to the same State and local regulatory requirements as any private corporation.
A project of the Corporation is subject to the zoning and subdivision regulations of the political subdivision where the project is located.
